title: JSX
content:
- JSX rules
	- Return single element
	- div/section/article or Fragment
	- use camelCase for html attribute
	- className instead of class
	- close every element
	- formatting
- JSX allows us to write HTML elements in JavaScript and place them in the DOM without any createElement()  and/or appendChild() methods.
- JSX converts HTML tags into react elements.
- You are not required to use JSX, but JSX makes it easier to write React applications.
- https://www.w3schools.com/react/react_jsx.asp
- https://reactjs.org/docs/jsx-in-depth.html

- JSX expression is just like normal JS object -> Can return/pass them from function; can use them as the value of the constant
- JSX don't have concept of loops, dont have IF and ELSE


- About true c and false c
	- When one of the operand is not boolean, js engine will convert it to true c or false c
	- empty: false c
	- at least 1 letter: true c
	- 0: false c
	- other: true c
